intro: Silene lynesii, commonly known as the Lynes' catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. Silene lynesii is an annual species, completing its life cycle within a single growing season. Its botanical features make it well adapted to arid environments, and it is often found in grasslands and open woodlands.
